enrich_metadata.mention_address: Sanger, Fresno County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Sanger is a city in Fresno County, California, United States. The population was 24,270 at the 2010 census, up from 18,731 at the 2000 census. Sanger is located 13 miles (21 km) east-southeast of Fresno, at an elevation of 371 feet (113 m).

attraction_reviewComments: This town is lovely. A great place to walk around & take in the area. Great shops, great restaurants & friendly people.
I liked the streets, building architecture, landscaping and window displays as well as the type of merchandise offered for sale. The antique street fair was a lot of fun and had... read more
Downtown Clovis has reinvented itself or continued to hold on to a charming 'main street.' The new shops focus on quality merchandise along with unique antique shops concentrated... read more
Old Town Clovis is a great place to visit. There are all kinds of shops and restaurants. It is very authentic to its historic roots. It's a fun place to walk around and enjoy the... read more
I Love Clovis. I frequently take my little dog Lucy for a walk through Clovis. The shop owners are friendly and the music is playing throughout my walk. The shops offer a variety... read more
Beautiful downtown area with plenty of shops and restaurants. The streets and sidewalks were clean and well-kept.
Old town Clovis is a delight. The cafes, shopping, and lovely walks are delightful. We loved the Mexican café. The food was delicious and the service excellent.
Lovely shops, antiques, food and perfect people watching little town with coffee shops and restaurants. Lovely to stroll through
Great little town old & rustic like you stepping out into 1930 & 40's If you are a visitor be sure and stop in at Old Town Barber shop for hair cuts & Sandy Junction for some... read more
I used to live in Clovis when I was a Park Ranger at Millerton Lake SRA. The town has changed considerably due to a large increase in population. Nothing is ever as you remember... read more
Sometimes I go here to just ramble around with no specific destination in mind. Early mornings are best in the summer, since it gets hot later in the day. Before the shops open I... read more
Old Town in Clovis, California is quaint, charming, historic small town with antiques & collectibles stores, restaurants & activities just about every weekend. Farmers market is... read more
This is what down town USA should be. Lots of fun shops and weekend events. They shut down the streets and you can enjoy that special event and/or hit up the local shops.

enrich_metadata.label: Merced, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Merced /mərˈsɛd/ (Spanish for "Mercy") is a city in, and the county seat of, Merced County in the San Joaquin Valley of Northern California. As of 2014, the city had a population of 81,743. Incorporated on April 1, 1889, Merced is a charter city that operates under a council-manager government. It is named after the Merced River, which flows nearby. Merced, known as the "Gateway to Yosemite," is less than two hours by automobile from Yosemite National Park to the east and Monterey Bay, the Pacific Ocean, and several beaches to the west. The community is served by the rail passenger service Amtrak, a major airline through Merced Regional Airport, and three bus lines. It is approximately 110 miles (180 km) from Sacramento, 130 miles (210 km) from San Francisco, 45 miles (72 km) from Fresno, and 270 miles (430 km) from Los Angeles. In 2005, the city became home to the tenth University of California campus, University of California, Merced (UC Merced), the first research university built in the U.S. in the 21st century.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Merced,_California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Merced, Merced County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.comment: Merced /mərˈsɛd/ (Spanish for "Mercy") is a city in, and the county seat of, Merced County in the San Joaquin Valley of Northern California. As of 2014, the city had a population of 81,743. Incorporated on April 1, 1889, Merced is a charter city that operates under a council-manager government. It is named after the Merced River, which flows nearby.In 2005, the city became home to the tenth University of California campus, University of California, Merced (UC Merced), the first research university built in the U.S. in the 21st century.

attraction_reviewComments: This is one of the area's most historical sites. This is close to the freeway, easy on and off. The only negative is that this place closes @ 3:00pm.

I liked the tour of the house where this man dug out his home underground. It was much cooler down there which will be nice if you go during the summer months. I wouldn't... read more
This is a terrific place to visit especially in the very hottest part of the summer as it is underground and about 10 degrees cooler.
I was amazed to see how a single man built this underground house and garden all by himself! Very interesting place to visit.
Worth stopping at. It's big and beautiful. Mostly covered, with some outdoors. Knowledgeable staff. Kid friendly.

A dwelling built completely underground many years ago that captures the pioneer, independent spirit of the settlers in the early part of this century

This was not what I was expecting! When you pull up it looks like nothing, but stay. It is very unique and you will never see anything quite like it. Check times for tours as... read more

Went to Gardens in the middle of Fresno's hot summer and despite the outdoor heat, a great local adventure in the coolness of the underground. Excellent for school trips, in my... read more
MIght not be worth a trip to Fresno but definitely worth seeing if you're there. The story will amaze you but the actual structure is more impressive. It's sad to think that... read more
A great place to go for a road trip or to stop by if your traveling on Hwy 99. Truly a great piece of history. Mr. Forsetiere was an amazing, smart man. Definitely before his... read more

Great place to bring visitors from out of town! We took our cousins from Colorado Springs Colorado in August 2014. Interesting, easy to park and get there and no traffic jam... read more
These gardens are absolutely incredible and well worth seeing. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable. One man's vision, determination and hard work resulted in an amazing... read more
Wonderful surprise in this area. Amazing gardens and the tour is completely worth the price of the tour.

This is a must see if you are in the Fresno area. You have to view how this gentleman created this underground living area.

This was a great way to kill a couple of hours out of the heat while I waited to check into my hotel. The tour guide was awesome and the price was fair. Prepare to be amazed.

enrich_metadata.abstract: Monrovia is a city located in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains in the San Gabriel Valley of Los Angeles County, California, United States. The population was 36,590 at the 2010 census, down from 36,929 in 2000. Monrovia has been used for filming TV shows, movies and commercials.

enrich_metadata.label: Clovis, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Clovis, Fresno County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Clovis is a city in Fresno County, California, United States. The 2014 population was estimated to be 102,189. Clovis is located 6.5 miles (10.5 km) northeast of downtown Fresno, at an elevation of 361 feet (110 m).
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Clovis,_California

enrich_metadata.label: Civic Center, Bakersfield
enrich_metadata.abstract: Civic Center is a district in Downtown Bakersfield, California. It is the center of government for the City of Bakersfield and the County of Kern, containing a collection of buildings used by the city, county, state, and federal governments. The district also contains all of downtown's sporting complexes. It also has the Rabobank Theater and Convention Center, which is the largest theater and convention facilities in the city.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Civic_Center,_Bakersfield
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Bakersfield, Kern County, California, United States of America

enrich_metadata.label: Sonora, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Not to be confused with Sonoma, California. Sonora is the county seat of Tuolumne County, California. The city population was 4,903 during the 2010 Census, up from 4,423 during the 2000 Census. Sonora is the only incorporated community in Tuolumne County.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Sonora,_California
